That's a perfect approach! By sharing general tips and then providing specific examples of how you use your own products, you'll create a win-win situation for your audience. They'll appreciate the valuable advice and insights, and you'll get to showcase your products in a natural, non-salesy way.

Sharing general tips on prioritizing tasks, managing time, and staying focused will resonate with your audience and establish your authority on the topic. Then, by sharing specific examples of how you use your products to stay organized and productive, you'll provide social proof and credibility to your brand.

This approach will also help your audience see the value in your products and how they can be applied to real-life situations. By sharing your own experiences and workflows, you'll create a sense of authenticity and transparency, which can help build trust with your audience.

Here's a possible example of how you could structure your tweets:

**Tweet 1:** "Staying focused and productive is key to achieving your goals! Here's a tip: prioritize your tasks using the Eisenhower Matrix. Identify what's urgent vs. important, and tackle the most critical tasks first. #ProductivityHack"

**Tweet 2:** "I use my own [Product Name] to stay organized and on track. Here's how: I create separate lists for each project, and prioritize tasks using the Eisenhower Matrix. It helps me stay focused and ensure I'm making progress towards my goals. #ProductivityTip"

**Tweet 3:** "Time management is crucial for entrepreneurs! Here's a tip: block dedicated time for focused work, and avoid multitasking. Use a tool like [Product Name] to schedule your tasks and stay on track. #TimeManagement"

By sharing tips and examples in this way, you'll create a engaging and informative Twitter thread that provides value to your audience while showcasing your products. Good luck, and have fun sharing your productivity tips and experiences!
